argument: A black market created by enforced vegetarianism would make it easier for more dangerous black markets, such as the drug and weapons markets, to find social acceptance and hide among less heinous markets.
A lot of rights that apply to humans are not applied to animals (example, the right to vote); therefore the rights of humans to choose is more important than the rights of animals to live.
A widespread shift to vegetarianism would have a massively negative impact on meat production, which is a large sector of the global economy.
Adopting vegetarianism will lead to millions of workers losing their jobs in the livestock industry around the globe.
Agricultural crop fields also kill animals, so vegetarianism doesn't actually save animal life.
Agriculture is based more on human slave labor than the meat industry, therefore by eating meat (and fewer plants) you rely less on slaves and support better working conditions
Although vegetables are cheaper, a lot of people don't know how to prepare filling and nutritious meals without meat, making vegetarianism unfeasible for many people.
Animals are a lot like ants, they are alive but do not live meaningful lives like humens, just like were allowed to kill ants we should be allowed to eat meat and not be vegetarian
Animals can be raised and slaughtered ethically, because they do not have a clear concept of their future lives nor do they have significant aspirations that would be harmed by a painless death.
Animals deserve less rights than humans, and it is legitimate for humans to prioritize their enjoyment over the suffering of animals.
Animals does not feel pain the way we do. Animal suffering is not the same as Human suffering and therefore it is not as immoral.
Animals might have the right not to excessively suffer, but not the right not to be eaten, this means that you don't need to adopt vegetarianism as long as you eat ethically sourced meat.
Attempting to enforce vegetarianism would create a black market for meat that has less safety regulation on the sale of meat and no protections for workers.
Being vegetarians makes it harder for people you eat with, since they have to accommodate your harsh preference.
Companies that ship or sell meat, such as butcher shops, would be destroyed if vegetarianism were enforced.
Eating a nutritionally balanced diet is easier if animal products are part of it
Eating meat is tasty, and eating tasty food is one of the greatest joys in life, therefore we shouldn't be vegetarians.
Eating meat is very enjoying to alot of people and a big part of their culture and life style. If we move to vegetarianism we will reduce human happiness.
Even if it is possiable to live a healthy life style without meat it is very difficult which means most people will live an unhealthy life style without meat.
Even though vegetarians avoid the hormones and antibiotics in meat, they still get very high doses of all the pesticides and herbicides that get doused over farmed plants.
Feeding humans is likely the most significant thing the animal can do anyway
High protein alternatives to eating meat (especially soybeans) require 16 times as much water as corn, and so the net effects of CO2 content in the atmosphere are often worse than livestock.
Human being have evolved to be omnivores who eat both plants and meat, so it is both healthy and appropriate that we continue to behave in a way that is consistent with our evolution.
Humans have a biological imperative to consume meat which should not be ignored through vegetarianism.
Humans have been fishing and eating mammals since the beginning. It's the way we raise livestock and overfish and farm fish that's the problem. There is a way to eat meat and be sustainable.
Humans require B12, which is only found in adequate amounts in meat, and supplements aren't absorbed by some individuals, making a vegetarian lifestyle unhealthy
Humans were born omnivores, so people should have the choice to do whatever they want and be able to eat meat.

In agriculture more animals are killed (pest extermination, tilling land kills underground dwellers, etc) than in the meat industry. Therefore by eating more meat and less plants you actually save lives
In food deserts, meat is more accessible than a diversity of vegetarian cuisine and ingredients.
In some areas (e.g., East Africa and other poor soil areas), livestock is the most efficient means of producing food.
Individuals are the best arbiters of their own individual conception of the good and should be able to decide if they want to be vegetarian.
Individuals should have the ability to do or consume anything which doesn't cause direct, considerable third party harms, which includes meat consumption and refusing vegetarianism.

Individuals would likely neglect their animals or release them into the wild if they could no longer sell them because vegetarianism, where they would die of starvation, be eaten, or face an even crueler fate.
It's harder to get all the things you need for a balanced diet while being vegetarian.
It is not immoral to eat animals because they are not members of our social constructs and do not have moral worth, therefore a meatless diet is not morally required.
Many children develop eating disorders, which could be very dangerous. Vegetarianism sends a dangerous message that some food is wrong, and that can drive such disorders.
Many cultures have meat based dishes which are important for their communities and the mechanisms by which they understand their history, which are inaccessible through vegetarianism.
Many cultures have traditions of eating meat; by banning eating meat you are hurting the rights of humans to express themselves.
Many religions require the consumption of meat on certain holy days, making enforced vegetarianism a violation of religious freedom.
Meat and meat-derived protein is higher quality than vegetarian protein substitutes.
Meat eating is am important part in many traditions holidays and religions,there for we can't adopt vegetarianism
Meat is a main source of protein and iron, therefore meat is a crucial part of a healthy dies and vegetarianism is unhealthy
Meat is an important part of certain cultures traditions. Removing it from their diets would harm their heritage
Meat is delicious, the New York Strips is one of the greatest meals of all time.
Meat is delicious and life is meant to be enjoyed.
Meat is delicious and most of the people of the world will not give it up.
Meat is very healthy, for everyone, proven in many studies around the world over the last hundreds of years. vegetarianism takes away this opportunity from humans of getting healthier and stronger.
Meat provides healthy saturated fats that vegetarians don't get enough of and are important to immune and central nervous system functioning.
Moral and rights are only true for humans, there for is not better to adopt vegetarianism

Most banned substances have seen a greater use in society (as with alcohol in the US in the 1920s); by making a national policy adopting vegetarianism we risk increasing consumption and undermining our effort.
Most of the arguments in favor of vegetarianism support veganism, which exaggerates many of our harms.
Most people who adopt vegetarianism, do it without supervision and hurt themself beasue if it, for example lack of Iron or portion
Much of the grazing land that animals use is not capable of general crop production, and therefore vegetarianism would not have a major impact on global food production.
Our needs as humans are our primary concern and it is difficult to eat a balanced meal and get all the nutrients we need without eating animals.
People have eaten meat for the intire history and the health of the body depands on substances that are most easily acquired by meat.
People need animal protein to be healthy - animals eat other animals.
People who support vegetarianism tend to preach in an annoying fashion; by ending that we could increase public happiness.
Problems with meat production should not be addressed by abandoning it completely; rather those concerned about animal welfare should work with farmers to make it more humane.
Since unlike humans, farm animals are exteremely unlikely to do something significant in their lifetime, there is no moral or real world implication to an animal having a shorter life.
Some animals are alive just because of the meat industry who gives them food and protects them, if we forego meat at once the meat industry will close and those animals will die sooner.
Some leaders of the vegetarian & vegan movements have committed literal acts of terrorism to push their agenda; a worldwide acceptance could be seen as bowing down to the method.
Some leaders of the vegetarian & vegan movements have committed literal acts of terrorism to push their agenda; a worldwide acceptance could be seen as bowing down to the method.
The meat industry hires millions of workers around the world and is the main source of income for many towns and cities, vegetarianism would jeopardize the livelihood of millions.
The meat industry is employing millions of people who will lose their jobs if we forego meat at once. We should prioritize the meat industry human workers over animals.
The meat industry sustains a huge population of animals that are unfit to survive in the wild. If a large portion of the population becomes vegeterian, these animals will be killed.
The only reason meat is bad for the environment is because companies don't raise animals in environmentally friendly ways, this makes fixing the meat industry the answer, not vegetarianism.
There are methods of meat production such as free range farming that allow for people to eat meat but still ensure animals are treated humanely, meaning that you can be moral without a meatless diet.
There are nutrients and vitamins that come predominantly from meat products, and people who abstain from them are likely to be less healthy.
There are religion ceremonies that include eating meat, being vegeterian will make us unable to fully take a part in them, so we will feel out of the group, unwanted (and go against god's will).
There are unique dietery benefits to meat consumption that are unavailable in any other way.
There is no evidence that vegetarianism is healthier than eating meat.

This would collapse Latin American democracies (Brazil, Uruguay etc.), whose political configurations have already been weakened by anemic international economic growth for luxury food items (steak particularly)
To have healthy vegatarian diet you will need a lot of supplements like b12 and iron which are expansive, the poor will be also sick.
Vegetarian diets are not necessarily healthy - you can still eat a lot of high-fat and sugary junk food such as french fries, pizza, soda, and candies.
Vegetarian diets don't have enough iron, calcium, and other minerals, making people more prone to disease and injury.
Vegetarian diets lack vital nutrients such as iron, vitamin B12, and omega-3 fatty acids.
Vegetarianism contributes to low bone density since there isn't enough calcium in the diet, which can cause long term issues with bone stability and strength.
Vegetarianism does not equate to having a healthy diet, as many people avoid eating meat but still eat many unhealthy things and have diets that are high in sugars, carbs, or fats.
Vegetarianism hurts the life quality, health wise (later discussed) and happiness wise. meat is yummy, people should have the possibility to eat meat if they please. they will enjoy it.
Vegetarianism is no more environmentally sound than omnivorous diets.
Vegetarianism is not healthy for pregnant woman because they don't get enough nutrients.
Vegetarianism is prone to protein, vitamin B12, Zinc, and other important chemical deficiencies, making meat inclusive diets healthier.

Vegetarians elevate the value of animal life over plant life. Research shows that plants respond electrochemically to threats and may feel fear, so vegetarians also cause harm every time they kill and eat a plant.
We only have one life to live and one of the most universal pleasurable experiences is eating good food, so although there is some delicious vegetarian food, eating meat is part of a good life.
We should not adopt vegetarianism because it will use up the political capital that could otherwise have gone to promoting renewable energy, which is more important to the environment.
We should not adopt vegetarianism because it would devastate communities that rely on livestock to bring in capital - like the entire country of Argentina, which depends heavily on beef.
We should not adopt vegetarianism because it would undermine the traditional food culture, and food is an important part of people's connection to their family and community.
We should not adopt vegetarianism because many people would not have access to healthy substitutes for meat, so their nutrition would decline.
We should not adopt vegetarianism because millions of peoples would lose their jobs if the meat industry went away
We should not adopt vegetarianism because most people do not want to, and the legitimacy of a policy rests with the public will.
We should not adopt vegetarianism because most people would be forced to rely on soy for protein without meat, which has hormones in it that are detrimental if consumed in excess.
We should not adopt vegetarianism because some nutrients, like omega-3 acids, are hard to come by from sources other than meat.
What does the question mean? Does it mean there should be a law? People should just eat what they want and be left alone. Enough with the nanny state!

With all the new research on the sentience of plants, the political argument about doing no harm to living creatures doesn't really hold water. Just because they can't move, that doesn't mean they don't feel pain.

You do not have to adopt vegetarianism to protect the environment. You can eat chicken that pollutes less or just eat a little meat.
